It's an attachment on Black ops 2 which while aiming it  shows the Target by Highlightsing the target via Diamond
Lmao, I have a story from Black Ops 1
Got revenge on a camper on Zoo.  Dude was lying prone with a sniper rifle by the entrance the entire game.  Wasn't very helpful to his team, but he was super annoying and I wanted to humiliate him
My best friend and I are gonna play some Halo
Ikr it's basically a sign saying"hey i'm right here come kill me"
He had a claymore set up on one side, so I went around the other way
I snuck up behind him and waited for my team to only need 1 more kill
Pulled out my noob tube, lined up a shot, and every got to see a final kill cam of me taking my sweet time aiming, then launching a grenade right up his ass xD
Because it was a projectile, the cam went into slow-mo and followed the grenade
i really played shooting based games before
I could imagine everyone were laughing their assds off

I played a lot of shooters when I was younger.  I was really big into Battlefield.  Eventually I learned that with sniper rifles, if you were close enough to a target, you could one-shot them in the chest
Destruction is what i love kn bf
So in Battlefield 3, one of my favorite things was to slap a red dot sight on my most powerful rifle, and just run into the fray
Yup.  I was definitely a sniper in those games
All i played was pokemon, terraria, Minecraft, and geometry dash my entire childhood
Liked playing on normal difficulty because sniping at range required a headshot for a kill
Nothing like pulling off a headshot on a target 460m away when they're in a full sprint
Aside from that, my hobby in Battlefield was c4 shenanigans
One time I killed a friend who was on the enemy team by accident xD
I was screwing around and setting up C4 at the base of a building in a way I knew would cause it to collapse
I ran out of the building and pulled the trigger, got a kill confirmation
If  i had a mic i would yell out ALLAH AKBAR and ms and the enemy
Got a message shortly after, apparently a friend was trying to be cheeky and knife me from behind without me knowing

But I was honestly extra dickish when it came to the APC vehicle.  I can't remember the name of it.  All I know is that it was heavily armored, could hold 6 players, and had machine guns.  Was basically a mobile spawn point / way for them to push in
Why am i imagining a Tk video game having Killcams Skyrim style
This thing normally spawned towards the middle / back of their base, so I would be in their back lines, planting C4 on this thing when it spawned, and would wait for it to start moving.
Let it move forward towards the battle a bit, THEN blow it up
Wasn't that popular, but I loved it.
Kim jong un has gone too far
Had a neat mechanic where if you were a menace, you'd get a bounty on you and some players on the other team would get a rough location for you, and a bonus if they off'd you
I LOVED that mechanic.  Was extra fun since my hobby was getting the dragon skins for weapons
But god damn the North koeans has good buildings
Homefront is also an example of why pre-order bonuses are a plague on the games industry
Only shotgun in the entire game is locked behind a pre-order bonus, probably Gamestop.
Not like it matters.  At some point years ago, the company was bought out and the multiplayer servers were shut down.

My dish will usually be meatloaf, mashed potatoes, and asparagus
Usually I eat the meatloaf last, but it's a tossup whether I eat the potatoes or asparagus first.  But usually it's asparagus.

"Before you lays a box of metal construction painted in olive green.  A handle for easy carrying is fixed to the top of the lid.  A simple latch holds the box shut."
"The box is, in every regard, unremarkable.  But you still find yourself drawn to it."
"While staring at this container, you hear a faint ticking.  Not certain from where it is coming, you sit there, confused."
"Until it dawns on you, it sounds like the ticking is coming from inside the box.  Holding your ear close, you swear you hear the ticking louder."

"Propelled by curiousity, you must look inside the box.  You grab the latch to open it.  As the metal latch loosens its grip on the lid, you feel yourself tense.  Why is there ticking?  Why inside the box?  Why start now?"
"You begin opening the lid, pulse quickening, muscles tensing.  Whatever is causing this ticking, you are about to find out.  As the inside of the box appears before you, you see... nothing."
"You see nothing, but the ticking continues louder than before.  Where is the ticking coming from?  As you close the lid, the ticking does not get softer.  Confusion sets in.  Then fear."
Paradoxically, fear of nothing but formless darkness, empty space, can take many forms in the imagination.
